title: My thoughts on Miss Fortune after Act III, and what her kit should aim for
body:
First of all I’d like to praise the lore and any other team involved in this particular development of the Bilgewater storyline, it was beautifully executed you guys! Now I have a tremendous storyline about one of my favorite characters in League. Her lore tells the tale of such a strong character that it only makes me want to play her even more, but she’s such an important piece in the Bilgewater storyline that, quite frankly, I’m dissapointed in the discrepancies that this beautiful new lore creates on MF’s current kit and gameplay. Things that I believe should have been addressed for the release of Burning Tides.

Both in the Bilgewater event and in the new Lore in her champion Page, Miss Fortune is depicted as this calculative, revenge driven girl that uses everything she has at her disposal to achieve her goals. Her whole persona is created as a consequence of a bloody “trade” between her mother (a weaponsmith) and Gangplank, **making Shock and Awe very, very important.** After this, she calculates every single move she’s going to make (wich is quite related to her kit). She deciets, kills, manipulates, and also uses her looks, charm and femininity to obtain what she’s after. After much planning, she becomes the mastermind behind Gangplank’s downfall in Bilgewater. This is amazing. But only one of these aspects is reflected in her kit, Calculation; you could also say that her damage ramping up is akin to gathering resources I guess . But why, why in the event she’s such a big part of, only got a minor VU and band aids over a kit that doesn’t reflect where Riot is taking her character in the lore? And these band-aids didn’t even address her core problems, the reasons she’s not picked competitively or higher up the ladder. 

I’m going to be as objective as possible with her current state, and if possible, we can discuss Miss Fortune and a Rioter can answer our questions.I’ll place the rework at the bottom of the current skill analysis for clarity and easier reading.

**Strut:** I think that since I started playing her, people have been asking, practically begging for, is  that after a certain level, it wouldn’t be cancelled by minion damage; however, we got the non direct damage mechanic. We didn’t get the scaling per lvl that was mentioned or the minion damage ignore at lvl 11. I think that Strut shouldn’t even be her passive anymore, it should be her W. By placing Strut in W and creating another passive surrounding her guns, she’d make more sense lore wise, and be an easier champion to read and balance.

**Double Up:** Even after the angle changes, it’s extremely unreliable. I don’t know what prioritizes first, is it champions? or targets with impure shots stacks? it feels random in most cases, sometimes it even hits directly on the side of the first target, even if they’re not in the cone. And then there’s the 150% situational damage in the second hit, while in lane being very powerful if mastered, it has no use outside lane or in late game. It provides an AA reset, but as you get attack speed, the skill cast time feels like it makes you lose DPS, specially after 1.6 AS. **Why can’t the skill just be allowed to critical hit and have it prioritize champions in the bounce?**

**Impure shots:** I understand the removal of GW, you want to get rid of the mechanic and it was a bunch of hidden power, but activating Strut is counter productive unless you can’t shave it off, and it won’t even come close to the power you took away by taking out GW in the first place. **Why was the AS% boost that got pushed to the PBE scrapped and not even tweaked to balance it?**

**Make it Rain: **It’s her zoning tool, but other than that, it adds close to nothing to the rest of her current kit. It scales on AP, and while the damage was focused on a 2 second period, the primary reason to cast it (the slow field) to try and zone enemies suffered the consequences. I thought the skill was going to be changed completely. **Why were improvements placed on something she didn’t use the skill for?**

**Bullet Time: **The skill concept by itself is fine, it just scales oddly, and by increasing the amount of stacks of impure shots instead of the AD ratio passively, MF doesn’t get the full benefit from this mechanic. It’s almost impossible to reach 8 stacks before a duel is over unless it’s a tank. **Why was this mechanic implemented in the first place if MF needs a perfect scenario to succeed?**

**TLDR;**
- Strut still lacks usability and I think it should be reworked into something else(read below)
- Double Up is still unreliable and has no real purpose outside of lane phase
- Impure Shots’s AS steroid is lackluster after the removal of GW and it activating strut is counterproductive if it doesn’t remain up for the duration of the active.
- Make it Rain still doesn’t feel satisfactory to cast, period.
- Bullet Time still scales oddly, more impure shots stacks instead of a higher ad ratio per stack places MF into situations she can’t make a reality

**My ideas are**
Rework:
**New Passive: Shock and Awe, Guns of Fortune**
MF’s basic attacks deal an aditional 6/8/10% of her AD as bonus magic damage, stacking 5 times to a maximum of 30/40/50%. Upon reaching 5 stacks, MF gains  30/55/80% attack speed. Indicator for MF as of how many stacks it’s a heart similar to her current AoE indicator.
Q: Double Up remains the same. Cast time improves with AS
**W: Strut**
Passive: After 5 seconds of not losing health to non-periodic damage, Miss Fortune gains 20/24/28/30/32 bonus movement speed, which increases by 8 each second up to a maximum of 50/60/70/80/90 bonus movement speed.
Active: Miss Fortune consumes her Shock and Awe stacks to briefly charm enemy champions around her for X seconds and doubles her bonus movement speed, this speed decays rapidly after 2 seconds (think Katarina W for range) (long cooldown though)

E: Make it Rain, remains the same, except  instead of a circle, it’s a rectangular AoE. Damage is physical, or no damage at all
R: Bullet Time
MF channels for 2,5 seconds, spraying 8 waves of bullets in a cone in front of her. Each wave deals 50/75/125 (+X% AP+X% bonus AD) physical damage. If MF has 5 stacks of Shock and Awe on activation she will consume the stacks to apply an extra 30/40/50% of her AD as magic damage per wave.

This rework focuses on the guns left  to MF by her mother and her capability for insane upfront damage (wich is the core of the “shock and awe” military strategy). She gathers resources (in this case, shock and awe stacks) to turn the tides in her favor. Extended duels and AoE damage will still be her speciality. She gets a mini charm to spice up the fantasy of a very resourceful, gorgeous bounty hunter, and Make it rain becomes a pure zoning tool to control the battlefield
Bullet time is the grand finale.

Numbers can be tweaked. I'd like everyone to join in the conversation so we can get something good going here!****

> And her kit is very cohesive. Her Q and W help apply more damage with her auto attacks, her E helps to slow targets for auto attacks and her ult, and her ult becomes even better off previous auto attacks. She's not a AD caster, she's an auto attack AD.

Thanks for telling me what her abilities did, I totally didn't know! (AND you were half wrong, heres why!)

Passive: A MS boost you lose as soon as you get hit by ANYTHING. (really good for helping her get her damage off!)

Her  Q: basically an aa reset in lane, it doesn't do anything later due to AA's hitting faster with the potential to crit. So true, it does help her do more damage in lane, but nowhere else.

W: well you already said it, it's a steroid, it gives her more damage on her aa's

E: This is her only ability that either needs to be made more reliable, or completely changed. It stops her autos that you seem so keen on talking about, for a very weak aoe slow field, that scales off of ap, how useful. (I'll be honest here, this ability is good in certain situations, but even in those situations it feels so terrible to use because of how much damage you lose.)

R: Wow, you get to stack to do as much damage as you did before her first rework. Fucking great. Really the stacking change was terrible. I have only played her a few times after this change, and I haven't played her in ranked since S3 because of it. (it makes 0 fucking sense to me why this change went through, it really pisses me off) What's even better is they decided to make the magic damage on the ult (due to w) scale off of AD, and the physical damage scale off of AP. Seriously? Who's the fucking genius that came up with this half-assed change? It was just added because they wanted to cut her damage unless she stacks. (after she was already in a weakened state due to pro-players getting her nerfed)

Yeah she has decent damage, and that's all a champion really needs, but when your abilities stop you from doing the thing you want to do most, (you said it yourself, auto attack) then you lose cohesion. Which was all well and good until they decided to make her auto attack to make her abilities stronger. It's no longer a choice in your play pattern. You get to do the same thing over and over again.

Miss Fortune's abilities fall off late game. It's why she doesn't scale well into late game aside from her ultimate and W passive. Which is totally fine by me due to how powerful her early and mid game are. Clearly she shouldn't be this strong at all points in the game and I don't think there's many champions that actually have consistent strength throughout the game. I don't even think saying "decent damage" is accurate, because she has a higher damage output than almost all ADCs in the game (not all though) including the ones considered top-tier picks.

You can go standard adc and do fine yes, but any other adc can go standard build and perform better because of scaling. Strut shield mechanic now encourages you to abuse the lifesteal path, but you also need high amounts of AD and Crits to be relevant. Build order is even more dependant on her lane performance now.

Miss Fortune actually is the least item dependant ADC for a lot of reasons. Her Q is a simple AA reset, it actually scales off almost 100% of her AD, but that's the main function of it as a reset. Her W has a nice attack speed buff, her E has a really strong slow that scales with ranks, and her ultimate has insane base damage.

Miss Fortune unlike most ADCs isn't really item dependant. Her kit is really simple and the base stats are more than enough, especially for early game. In comparison to other ADCs;

Half of Draven's kit only scales off bonus AD, and his entire purpose is just to build a ton of AD and nuke someone. He's really item dependant since his Q doesn't have base damage and It's what makes Draven-Draven.

Vayne and Kalista are really item dependant to stack Silver Bolts or Rend. Without it, they're not really going to do much damage. Vayne has her tumble and Kalista has her spear, but without items they don't really do much. Aside from maybe Vayne with her ultimate ability.

Sivir doesn't even have base damage on her W as far as I know, and her Q has really low base damage too. She doesn't do that much damage with her abilities until she gets items, and also she doesn't have any attack speed buffs aside from her ultimate or her W reset.

Miss Fortune's abilities are really nice and they all have great base stats, she's really not item dependant and while there will always be a certain build that's the BEST, you can build her with anything and still do extremely well in comparison to most other ADCs.

I'm not going to even take this as a joke because you clearly believe in what you just said. But I'm going to prove you wrong.
MF is extremely item reliant, even more so considering she brings no utility like Sivir or Kalista. At most, you could say that the utility she brings is mixed damage, and to make her mixed damage a possible threat, she needs a huge amount of AD (because of the low AD ratio) and Attack speed (because of the amount of stacks she needs). Where would she get this if it's not with items? a Nice attack speed buff is Jinx's switcheroo or Tristana's Rapid Fire. MF's is okay-ish at most.

Draven can nuke you because of the AD ratio and criticals of his Q. He'd be closest to MF in item dependancy, but his Q can critical while MF's Impure shots are magic damage.

Out of all the examples you gave, Vayne would be the least item dependant, because of her true damage scaling in W, and even so, she needs items and time to carry. Both Kalista and Sivir bring insane utility to the team, but that doesn't mean they don't need items to work properly (Kalista with Ruunan, Sivir with AD). 

Sivir uses in her total basic attack damage for the first hit of W, has no cap in targets for the bounces, just a cap of 40% damage reduction at most. The first hit also applies on-hit effects and can critical, It's also an AA reset and she gets off the AAs quickly because of her R interaction (extra attack speed while W is active)

-AD Ratio on Q that can critical and lifesteal. Applies her W and other on hit effects
-Late game scaling with %HP damage
-Mobile
-Has self peel and situational stun with E
-AD boost and MS boost for passive on R.

-Gets bonus extra gold if he kills you because of his passive (wich goes up as you catch your axes)
-Snowballs way easier than MF does

-Her poke is super reliable and hits like a truck

-She gets MS when she damages you.

{{champion:429}}

-Amazing team utility
-Infinite damage stacking on Rend
-Insane objective control
-Q enables both her passive, Rend and the W passive of extra damage with your bound ally. Can also transfer rend stacks if it kills the first target.

-Impure shots turn her into a mixed damage dealer, wich is hard to itemize against. Ramps up in damage, favoring extended trades.

Of course, in paper, it all sounds fine and dandy. **But taking into account that:**
-Q doesn't crit and the cast time severes your AA chain as you get Attack speed.
-Impure Shots have a very low AD ratio per stack, and you need 8 stacks for it to reach it's full potential. The damage isn't factored in Critical Strike or Lifesteal.
-Make it rain has a cast time, it's also magic damage that scales of AP. It doesn't even apply impure shots stacks to glue her kit together.

it makes all her strenghts fade in comparison with other ADCs.
Draven and Vayne both Have similar AD Steroids on their Qs (85% ad and 50% ad) both apply On hit effects and the modified AA can critical as normal while not taking the bonus damage in, while lifesteal takes the whole damage into consideration.  Now Miss Fortune's AD steroid is Impure shots, to access the full damage she needs 8 stacks on the target, it's 48% AD magical damage so it's not taken into consideration for lifesteal, critical, nor benefits from amor penetration.
Draven also scales fully on AD on all his damaging skills. Vayne has %Max HP pure damage every 3 attacks.

And Bullet time, while having one of the possible highest damage outputs in game, it's only with the best set up possible (wich is 8 stacks already on the target at lvl 16). The maximum damage output without stacks is 1000+20% of your AP (as physical damage)+216% of your AD, as magic damage, while it's 384% AD with max stacks before casting. The scenario for Bullet time to be at used it's strongest is almost impossible, It's like asking anyone to sit for a full channel of a Katarina ult

What we're trying to do here is assess Miss Fortune's weaknesses and kit, you're the one who directly compared her to other adcs in your previous post.

Her high mixed damage gives her a nice midgame where it's hard to itemize against her. However, her mixed damage becomes her downfall late game when it comes time to itemize penetration. I think it's a fair tradeoff.

What I don't understand is why her ult scales off AP for physical damage. Makes absolutely no sense.
Lucian and Sivir both have physical abilities that scale off AP. Think there might be someone else.
But those are hybrid scalings. At least they build AD and get more damage out, with MF that's not the case.

Hi, just as you said, there are several things that could be done to improve MF without doing major changes. The changes I posted here are just another way out, trying to bring the identity the lore gives her forward.
I moved the impure shots effect to the passive because her current kit relies completely on stacking impure shots to ramp up damage in both her AAs and ulti. And I don't think Riot wants to change this completely. 

Let me explain the new passive a bit further, I may have missed a few points (I'll edit the first post, thank you for pointing it out) it does the following:
   1. Like Ashe's passive, the stacks are counted on yourself, not the enemy. Wich means that you could possibly gain stacks with minions/monsters and then proceed to trade/duel.
   2. It still ramps like the current impure shots mechanic,  a bit higher actually, with less conditions. 5 Stacks for +50% AD instead 8 stacks for +48% at lvl 16.
   3. The AS boost by reaching 5 stacks would give her an "I'm ready to own your sorry butt" feeling during trades. It's not like Jinx's Q that ramps as she attacks, it happens **only** after reaching 5 stacks. My first idea was making it ramp just like the AD ratio though, final result is the same anyways.
   4. Riot loves moments of power and decision making, wich is why both W and R consume the stacks. Trade offs and decisions she needs to make. Clarity for her opponents because she'd have an indicator of how many stacks she has accumulated.

It's also the same for Strut, I think Riot wants Strut to remain on her kit (because of the current changes), wich is why I kept it, but turned it into a skill. As her passive it barely has chances of tinkering with it. Also.....don't you feel impure shots is her true passive anyways?

By makig Strut into a skill, there are new possibilities of what could it do. In my version,  It's not a dash nor a jump so if she can't move after casting Strut she's still done for. But it opens the possibility for actually chasing, you'd consume your stacks to close the distance between you and your target with the speed boost that decays, but cannot be taken down to 0 with 1 damage from a minion. The charm is just the icing on the cake, because of her lore and because I hate when Rengar or akali jump and obliterate me without any possible solution from my side other than flash.
